title: Hire LA’s Youth — Starter Jobs
eligibility: Ages 14–24; right to work; work permit if under 18
notes: Job readiness + placement via community orgs; seasonal fairs and cohorts in LA.

title: Youth@Work — LA County
organization: LA County Department of Economic Opportunity / AJCC
pay: Paid (e.g., recent cycles $17.87/hr up to ~140 hours)
notes: Entry jobs with training through AJCCs; rolling events countywide.

title: Recreation & Parks Youth Jobs
organization: City of Los Angeles Department of Recreation & Parks
type: Paid part-time jobs (Rec Aide, Camp, Aquatics)
notes: Year-round postings; search roles like Rec Aide and seasonal camp staff.

title: LA County Pool/Lake Lifeguard (Seasonal)
eligibility: 16+; must pass swim test and training academy
notes: Good for strong swimmers; hiring every spring for pools/lakes.

title: Teen Council for Conservation
notes: Lead conservation projects; build leadership and comms skills.

title: Marine Science Teen Internship
organization: Natural History Museums of LA County (NHM)
eligibility: High school juniors & seniors who live/attend school in Boyle Heights
pay: First year unpaid; returning interns become paid museum employees
notes: Interpretive marine science; peer mentors in year two are paid.

title: High School Internship (Art & Tech / Museum)
organization: Los Angeles County Museum of Art (LACMA)
eligibility: High school students (check current cycle details)
pay: Varies by cycle; check program page
notes: Hands-on arts/museum experience; some cycles emphasize art + tech projects.

title: Community Teen Interns
notes: STEM education roles and visitor engagement; 16+ for most volunteer tracks.

title: High School Summer Internship
eligibility: Current HS juniors/seniors in Long Beach area (varies by year)
notes: Departments across the Port; transportation required.

title: Student Leaders (Paid Nonprofit Internship)
eligibility: Current HS juniors or seniors; legal right to work
pay: Paid (8‑week placement at a local nonprofit)
notes: Competitive; includes travel to the Student Leaders Summit in Washington, DC.

title: LA-HIP (Biomedical Research)
eligibility: Los Angeles area high school students (competitive)
pay: Check program; includes college prep & mentorship
notes: College-level instruction, SAT prep, and research exposure.

title: LAXceeders Youth Volunteers (Airport)
eligibility: 16–18; current high school student; ID + background check
notes: Great aviation exposure; minimum monthly hours required.

title: Teens Leading Change (Civic Projects)
notes: Design and run community projects with your local branch librarian.

title: Student Conservation Association — Community Crews
eligibility: Ages ~15–19; some roles 14+ if turning 15 before start
notes: Trail work, habitat restoration, and green jobs exposure.
